place_description:
OUR COFFEE
The QC's own Nightflyer Roastworks, bean to cup, roasted in-house? It's what we do.

LOCAL EATS
Full brunch/evening menu with loads of options for all palates (brunch until 3pm). Local fresh pastries baked in the city make for affordable, tasty, nourishing meals.

BEER/COCKTAILS/WINE
Join us in the afternoons or after work for local craft beer, fun daily cocktail specials and an extensive wine selection.

EVENTS
Rotation of various performers and activities… Trivia every Tuesday, live music every Friday and comedy every Saturday! Check in on our social platforms for updates. Cheers!

Parking validation in SkyHouse garage for 90 minutes

reviews_data.review_text: Good coffee and dope spot. Nice and chill and good amount of space!
Great service and delicious espresso drinks. The food is good too but not my favorite. Very friendly staff.
Bestest place EVERRRRRRRRR!!!!! This place is the NICEST!!! The people are always kind and the drinks are always perfect. Miss going there everyday and spending way too much money haha.

NEVER AGAIN... I came to this restaurant after searching for "BEST VEGAN BREAKFAST" in Charlotte, NC, and when we arrived the cashier said almost everything here can be made vegan. We ordered a "VEGAN" MAPLE SAUSAGE EGG AND CHEESE SANDWICH. The cashier brought our food to the table, and we started to eat. A bite or two into the sandwich and we noticed that it tasted and looked JUST LIKE real MEAT. I brought the sandwiches back to the counter, and asked the manager were these VEGAN, because they taste like meat. He said almost verbatim "WE DIDN'T HAVE ANY MORE VEGAN SAUSAGE, SO WE JUST GAVE IT TO YOU THE REGULAR WAY". I was applaud, and extremely disappointed they gave us PORK and no one apologized or tried to accommodate for our experience. I tried to stomach it, and continue eating my side of grits, but started throwing up midway. I've been vegan for 15 years, my wife 4 years, and my 8 year old son for his whole life. I must say this is the WORST EXPERIENCE I'VE HAD.

Authentic coffee! They housed an area with local beers. Most days I drop by for an iced latte with extra shot and lavender.. some days I do for sour beer!

Edit after living in Charlotte for over 3 years: This has become my number one coffee place in the entire of NC! Everywhere I go I make sure to get coffee and nothing beats QCG! The best and most consistent good coffee. Today I got one of their seasonal drinks (pictured: Lavender Lemonade) and I can't believe I've been sleeping on it! Burritto You Want is my ultimate favorite food they serve; their Chicken and Waffles are good too!

I can't recommend this place enough especially if you're a coffee snob like me!
Excellent coffee shop. Came for an open mic night it was legit.
Nice
Amazing food, Great Customer Service! Perfect Location!!!
Gabe is amazing!!
Excellent coffee and food!

Finally made my way to Queen City Grounds and my first visit was really nice. I enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere, the food and beverage, and the location. I really love that there are vegan options for the food, that took it over the top for me. It was a great way to start my work day mentally and to physically enjoy some healthy food. I ordered Alexis on Fire (Vegan Option) with the Butterfly Lavender Lemonade. I will be going back.

So today is Wednesday July 10th and after my last bad experience I have still been a faithful customer based on the food not the service. I come in today to order breakfast and tea. I had to use the bathroom and figured it logical to use it first then order especially since there was a wait to order. I asked for the code and was brushed off ignored and left standing around for code for over 10 minutes. I don't know why the customer service here is so bad but I spend my earned money here everyday and still they disrespect. I will start looking into other places to eat.

Food amazing however the cashier girl has a bad attitude and I won't be back
Very friendly Staff Helpful Menu Club Sanwiches Are Delicious eat inside or outside
Wherever I travel I typically order breakfast burritos but no one tops The Burrito I Want or Alexis on Fire. Glad to be back in town and eating large at The Landing.
Excellent food, loved the $5 mimosa.

Tasty, tasty, tasty! I walked in sleepy and hungry and woke up awake and full. It was a great spot to start off a day exploring the city. I wasn't working but the second floor looked like a great spot to hold up for the day and get things done.
Delicious food! I went on a Tuesday night when they were having trivia and it sounded like a lot of fun.
Always delicious food & the best coffee! I come here daily & love that the staff remembers you & is so personable!

I truthfully feel this could be so much better and probably is other days but I went yesterday 6.7.24 and to start the wrong menu was up despite it was a little after 4pm and there were multiple people in there. Once we started to order she was like oh wrong menu were not offering that menu it's after 3 pm yeah it's after 4pm. Then proceeded to tell us a multitude of things we couldn't order off the menu. She named everything fried it seems plus all flate breads. You got coffee and a burger to choose from at this point. She wasn't rude per-say but she wasn't plesant either seemed very annoyed to be there. I will give credit to the burger being good and the coffee tasting good.  However, I don't recommend and I'll not be returning either. If I want to pay almost 70$ for that type of service I'll at the least go where I have menu option or better yet a better attitude to make up for having nothing. Attitude means a lot to me bc customer service is rather worth a bad spot over great food and horrible service.

The place was very nice and clean. This was our first time visiting. They were out of cold brew, the vanilla latte wasn't great and I was surprised how long our food took and the portion sizes for the price. I think the portion size was perfect BUT the prices were definitely too high. There are many amazing coffee shops with great food here in Charlotte to choose from. $77 (including tip) for 4 drinks, 2 wraps, avocado toast and a grilled cheese.

Overall, I enjoyed my time at Queen City Grounds , but I have to give it four out of five stars because I ordered food and I wanted my pastry warmed up, but the oven was broken and also I sat inside and there were multiple flies and they were bothering me so I just didn't really enjoy the atmosphere that much but obviously there's only so much they can do to control that.

It's such an amazing quaint coffee shop. I'm from out of town and was visiting my son. And this coffee shop really made me fall in love, lol. I love a good, strong coffee,amazing pastries, and that's what you'll get here. I purchased ( 3 days in a row ) their delicious Monte Cristo on multi grain bread and Lavender Latte   .  Great prices, atmosphere absolutely fun and chill. Coming back in June or July and will make this my breakfast home away from home.
One of the highlights of my day! Food is so good, employees are super nice. Just a lovely neighborhood shop!

On Saturday, i went there for a coffee. I got my coffee and sat inside. All of a sudden, water poured on me and my wife. We got wet and my coffee ruined. A tap broke on their counter. Anyways, i clean up myself and returned my coffee, they didn't apologize at all, very indifferent to what happened. They said they cannot make new coffee because of the broken tap, but they will refund. She went to the computer and said it is refunded. But that was a pure lie. Horrible horrible horrible disrespectful crazy service.

Check your orders before you leave!!
I ordered the burrito with everything that comes with it but I added sausage. I checked my bag before I left but unfortunately it's hard to see what's in a burrito unless you open it all the way up. When I got home the only thing the burrito had in it was egg, pico, avocado, cheese and spinach... where is the meat??? No bacon that already suppose to come on it. And I paid extra for sausage... no sausage. It's a vegan burrito basically which I didn't order and was charged for the extras. It was missing sauce as well. I'm not sure how you ignore an entire order and make it how you want? I called up there 3 times and of course nobody answered. There's other spots I normally go to but I wanted to try something new. That's on me. And I won't make that mistake again. Pay attention to the orders that come in.

Food & Coffee are all delicious. Subtracting stars due to the wait time that I have every single time I go here. I've been here three times now and have waited for my simple food order for 30 mins plus each time. I only order a bacon, egg, & cheese or the grits. So if you are willing to wait a long time for good food, then this is your place! it is located near my office so I will definitely be back but I recommend placing an order online :)

This coffee shop offers you an experience. There's so much to enjoy here, including trivia nights, and nestled nooks for reading and working. I enjoyed my caramel latte with turmeric agave. I did not taste the food but it look really good and I will be back as they offer breakfast and lunch.

Redemption!!! I have been living nearby for a while now. A few months ago, I received poor service and I had written Queen City Grounds off. Tonight we needed a coffee and decided to give it another shot, we were very pleased!

Ben saved the day when he helped us out! He made us feel welcomed and helped us decide what to order. We're not coffee experts, but he didn't care about that, he helped us without judgement. Ben was just an all around pleasure, we really enjoyed talking with him. We already plan to visit him again tomorrow!

After ordering, I enjoyed one of the best latte's ever. I am so glad to see that Queen City Grounds has improved their staff. It is so nice to feel welcome when visiting the neighborhood coffee shop. I'm hoping this could our spot, maybe even our home away from home!

If you're looking for top notch service and quality coffee, I think this is the place!

If you need a quick cup of coffee or tea, this might not be the best place to stop. Took 7-8 minutes to get my cup of herbal tea. They seemed understaffed yesterday. Otherwise, if you are looking for a place to hang out, this might be an ideal place.
Cool place for coffee and morning bites

Stopped in for some food & coffee while on the road. Ordered two coffees, grilled cheese, bagel & breakfast sandwich. Waited around 30 minutes. They packed my items in a bag and handed it off. Got back on the road and once we opened our food we noticed we had been given a grilled cheese & two plain bagels. A bagel in place of what was supposed to be a breakfast sandwich. Could not turn back to fix the issue as we were already back on the road.  Tried calling, no answer. Waste of time & money.

Do NOT come here!! So unprofessional. They randomly close whenever they feel like it. Gave faulty parking validation after claiming they validate in the adjacent garage. All around TERRIBLE experience. Coffee isn't even that great!
2nd time in Charlotte and we came back! Once again the food is 10 out of 10! And the atmosphere is amazing.

Coffee is always overpriced and mid, but the barista charged me $9 for a drink I didn't order. She explained the only option they had for my drink iced was "super size" since I specifically asked about the price, and it was served hot anyway. I never leave reviews, but the price is absolutely not worth it and not sure why the barista did me like that. Out $10 for the wrong drink, made poorly. Cute shop though.

Cool spot to grab a coffee and work a little. Not as quiet if you need it office / library type quiet. WiFi works great. Bathrooms super clean. Parking you have to pay for in a garage. Cappuccino wasn't very good and the female barista wasn't very nice (to me), the male barista was very nice, pleasant, and talkative.
They have a VERY LIMITED menu. The drinks were mediocre. We had tea. The Flatbread was tasty. The live entertainment was awesome.
Great vegan options !!

I don't usually leave reviews, but today was our first time at QCG, and I am so excited to have found this place!! My husband and I have been vegetarian for years but finally moved towards a vegan diet only a few months ago, and finding filling vegan food on the go has been the biggest challenge by far! When I saw the number of vegan options on QCG's menu, it seemed too good to be true. I ordered three different breakfast sandwiches so my husband, toddlers, and I could try a variety, and they were all delicious! Better tasting and more unique than any non-vegan breakfast sandwiches I've had. I'm sure we'll be back very soon, and next time, I want to try their coffee as well!

QCG, thank you for having so many options for us!

The staff is always extremely friendly and it's a great spot for a local. Chris, Asha, and Liv are PHENOMENAL and the reason I come. It's disturbing when people find this place below par, because it is absolutely not that. Recently a review has been posted depicting the spot to focus on regulars and that is not true. This is our neighborhood and we will remain as patrons. QCG is the spot to come.

One of my favorite spots to grab coffee and hang out. Service is always excellent and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. The baristas and bartenders are all so personable and likeable. Chris is one of my favorite bartenders in Charlotte and Asha is so fun to talk to.

This is my Central Perk of 4th ward! The food and coffee is amazing, and this place is always a friendly & inclusive atmosphere. The staff are always attentive and go above and beyond to make sure everyone is taken care of.

THE SERVICE HERE WAS GARBAGE! ABSOLUTE TRASH!!  The man taking my order was a tall white gentleman with brown hair and a green shirt on and he completely ignored my boyfriend and I when we were trying to order. He was more worried about his friend group that was sitting at the bar instead of taking our order. He also felt the need to charge his vape right on the counter where the cash register is. Otherwise, food was good and coffee was great! Definitely should come for the coffee.
May have been an off-day for this establishment, but bad service and false advertising about validating parking. Will not come back
Staff is always nice. Good breakfast menu. Try a coffee tonic, it's strangely delicious. Their more traditional coffee drinks are also executed well.
Maple sausage egg on everything bagel was delicious! Not too sweet, love the flavor of maple syrup!
This is a true coffee house environment with the BEST CHAI ! Grateful to have found it. Staff is amazing and the food,  unexpected!

I love the atmosphere of this place! It always takes me a while to order. The staff are always very patient. It is a little pricey but my food always comes out piping hot and the coffee is DELICIOUS! I recommend the Fast Times at Vegan High sandwich. Sooo delish!

Update: also love the Legends of Zelda

I really like the vegan food options. I am however exhausted by getting my $7.5 latte served in a paper cup even when I specifically order it in a mug. I even say "for here, in a mug" at the register and there it is, 2 min later, in a paper cup. If there's a magical code to get it in a mug please let me know.
Regardless of that continuous annoyance, I still give this place 4/5 stars and will continue to patron it. Thanks for the many tasty vegan selections.

Ordered a golden chai latte and a "Burrito You Want". The lattes design was a nice touch and it tasted wonderful. This breakfast burrito was also spot on. The corn chips added a really nice texture component and the spicy queen sauce helped turn the flavor up another notch. This was a really great burrito that I would definitely eat again. This coffee shop is a great spot to either hangout and chat or grab a coffee and go. I would happily come here again if I was in the area.
Great coffee in Charlotte!
BEST IMPOSSIBLE BURGER ON THIS SIDE OF TOWN !
Good place for coffee and breakfast, but one of the staff was not that friendly and seemed upset.
I enjoyed my breakfast burrito and Coffee . Nice vibe as the atmosphere is trendy and inviting

Such a cute spot. Went 3x before leaving this review. Only thing I didn't like the first visit, was how hard the sour dough bread was. I know some people may prefer it, but it was a bit too hard for me. The second time I asked for a soft bagel and it was absolutely delicious. The bakery items are so good!! Loved the coffee too!! Great place!!
Great and chill environment to spend some time and share very tasty desserts and drinks with friends and family.

We just ate two hamburgers, but we felt dissatisfied with the service. The person who served us, a man with a beard, took our order and repeated it and asked us that he should bring each of the hamburgers but he charged us for only one and we realized when only one hamburger arrived. The man treated us with discrimination.

I had a GREAT experience at Queen City Grounds. I got the Legend of Zelda (how fun and unique!) and the grits for brunch, with a Queen City Salad to go for my dinner later. All of the food was great! I was personally assisted by a manager, named Tyler, who was incredibly kind and patient with me, as this was my first time at QCG and with the menu...and I greatly appreciate all of his help!
This store ate
This is a great place with the nicest environment. Great coffee and food. Definitely coming back here. I love QCG!!
It's a beautiful yummy place with amazing coffee and food! I recommend the avacado toast (it's bussin)
Best coffee in Charlotte!!! Great vibe, service and food
I LOVE QCG! The staff is super friendly and attentive, food is always fresh, and the coffee is to die for. I used to be a Starbucks girl but, I'm converted!
Lovely spot!
A true willingness to indulge the want and whimsy of my wayward soul, the space enraptures, the tastes and smells entice, the staff delights...also clean bathrooms...5 stars
This is a must stop coffee shop in Charlotte. The coffee, food, and vibes are spectacular. **chefs kiss**
Love QCG. The coffee is amazing. The people are friendly. Atmosphere is great. Matt, the owner, is a great guy, too! Highly recommend
Great coffee, great staff, very cool location with a lot of personality.

As an out-of-towner, Queen City Grounds is my go-to spot whenever I visit Charlotte! This specialty coffee shop not only roasts their beans in-house but also the baristas are always super friendly and helpful. Had an oat milk latte and I can't wait for the next time I'm in town to stop by!

Recently moved here with my partner! I'm very particular about where I get my coffee and this place definitely checked all my boxes. One of our top priorities is finding a place with inclusivity and a positive atmosphere, and neither of these were lacking when we walked through the door. Great place to sit and do work. I will definitely be coming again!
One of the best spots I've been to in a long time. Good food, good coffee and the staff was exceptionally attentive and welcoming. Will definitely be a regular:)

My recent visit to this cafe left much to be desired. The coffee was disappointingly bland, and the pastries seemed like they had seen better days. The service was lackluster, with inattentive staff adding to the overall underwhelming experience. Sadly, I won't be returning anytime soon.
Subpar in every aspect - from stale coffee to lackluster pastries and an outdated ambiance. Not recommended.

Great coffee, delicious food, and excellent service! The baristas are incredibly friendly, and the 'Burrito You Want' is a must-try! Their menu is exceptionally accommodating, they offer validated parking, and the fast internet makes it an ideal spot for work or just hanging out. Additionally, the interior is uniquely designed with ample seating both downstairs and upstairs. 10/10 would highly recommend!
Great staff, Wonderful coffee, and a solid location! I'm from out of town but QCG is my go to when in the area!
Poor service...poor attitudes.
The bar is a great place to catch a hockey game and play trivia!
Expensive murky ahh coffee I rather be drinking Flint Michigan water

I try and give all local coffee shops multiple chances before leaving reviews like this but it has to be said. This place is by far the worst experience I've had in Charlotte as a whole. I went in 3 times on recommendation from a friend and most of the times my latte was made wrong, they didn't want to accommodate my dietary needs but definitely for other customers, and the cherry on top is that my food came cold. The only plus that the shop itself is aesthetically pleasing. I got my order fixed one time while I was there and the worker that helped me (chubby with a septum piercing) but aside from that NADA!
Used to love this place now it's completely gone downhill. Was very unorganized and waited forever for my order. Food tasted stale and coffee was watery. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
Unfortunately the food tasted bland and the service the other day was unorganized and messy! I was really disappointed.
My latte tasted sour and I waited forever to get my drink too. This place is very unwelcoming and I don't recommend anyone to come here. If I could give 0 stars, I would!
Terrible customer service, will never come back here.
The coffee was always great but the addition of the bar and entertainment has greatly improved the atmosphere. The live music was especially great!!

QCG is my favorite coffee shop in the area. The coffee is top notch and the food is always great. Also, I must point out how good the service is. I love to grab my coffee and food and head upstairs and grab a book out of the small library and get my caffeine fix while I relax. I highly recommend this coffee shop!

Staff was rude & inattentive. I had ordered an impossible burger because I'm vegetarian. Firstly, it took 35 minutes to get out to me but I am usually forgiving of this because I understand many places are understaffed. The real issue is that they gave me a BEEF PATTY. I was absolutely stunned & felt sick to my stomach because I've been vegetarian for 6 years. When I asked to be compensated, they told me that they'd be right back and I waited an additional 20 minutes to speak with a manager only for no one to show up... this place does NOT care for its customers or their dietary needs!
Very cool looking place, food was just frozen food heated up and coffee was flavorless. Service and customer service was very poor.

They let me order, then told me they're out of stuff for my order after I already paid. I requested a refund and the lady told me to hold on and started making coffee for several people, while I'm just standing there waiting so I can get the refund and leave. Then they start taking orders for everyone who walked in after me. Not even sure if I got a refund or not, but was so over it by the time I walked out of there. Terrible service!

I'm pretty disappointed, I've been coming to qcg for years but I hadn't been in a while until today. I was excited to see they added cold foam to the menu. Long story short I paid 14 bucks for a drink, which isn't the issue. I tipped $5 because the young lady at the register was so kind and nice, so the drink was $9. The male barista making my drink put the tiniest splash of syrup in the heavy cream to make the cold foam, so it literally taste like nothing. Also the cold foam was over blended into whip cream consistency it's way too thick. All in all I wasted $14 because I threw it out bc the drink tasted like milk and espresso and I ordered a hazelnut latte. Also the guy barista isn't friendly.
Our group area reservation was a bit messed up, though sorted nicely and quickly.

Super flexible menu where almost everything has a vegan version, chill vibe, good coffee, and great street corner view.  The price is at industry average; a lot of other places in the area have similar offerings for the same.

The drip coffee is flavorful to where it's good black or with cream.

coffee was good but food was really disappointing especially for the price. we ordered chicken and waffles and the chicken was frozen chicken patties and grocery frozen waffles. we enjoyed the atmosphere over all.
Best coffee so far in Charlotte

No shortage of great, local, coffee shops in Charlotte, and this is one of them. Their original location is in 4th Ward under the Skyhouse apartments, they have been in business about 5 years. Their second location is slightly west of the city on Morehead. I love the coffee here, but moreso I love the vibes. The downstairs has a bar and each seat has a large window to people watch. The upstairs is quaint, tucked away, and even has a little library nook.

This is one of the few shops I'm tempted to buy merch from, their logo is of an owl that is artful yet simplistic.

They are open later in the day, offer a brunch menu in the morning, a later in the day menu after 3 PM, and alcohol- I assume later in the day, there is a bar with beer taps and a beer fridge.

They offer events several nights of the week.

Wi-Fi password is "staygrounded".

They will validate parking in the Skyhouse garage for 1.5 hrs if you ask. They will hand you a receipt to have scanned upon exiting the garage.
Great

Queen City Grounds overall has a great vibe. I'm not a big coffee drinker but I had a Carmel latte there and it was delicious. I also appreciate the vegan options they have for burritos. I was recommended by a very nice guy named Emmanuel to try "The Burrito You Want" it's super flavorful and very filling. Overall service is a 10/10.

Amazing! Great to bring laptop and work for a few hours. Every food item is TOP NOTCH! My favorite is the everything bagel breakfast sandwich! The atmosphere is so cute and quaint with several nooks for hanging and chatting with friends. Conveniently located in Uptown!!! I highly recommend this place for ANY coffee shop needs!!

Nice local coffee spot with a wide selection of breakfast options. The avocado toast was lighter than expected but very tasty. The breakfast sandwich was good but don't order if you're in a rush as they take a while to make. Loved their latte!
Great drinks!
One of my favorite spots.

Where should I start. This place is ideal. Welcoming atmosphere all are welcome!
The coffee was amazing and food was superb. The upstairs is cozy. We sat down to enjoy our coffee and breakfast sandwiches and before we knew it, we were talking for almost 1hr and a half. The prices are decent as well. Not your average coffee shop!

The. Monte. Cristo. Oh. My. Gawd.

The sweet compote, the herbal notes from the rosemary ham, the bit of heat in the back of the throat from the pepper jack, the perfect crunch of the roasted bread.

It's the perfect sandwich.

The coffee is also delicious!
Very relaxing atmosphere. Food was amazing and the staff was very informative and friendly.  Visited from out of town and stayed close by. Definitely a must have breakfast of brunch.
Super friendly servers. Good coffee and a great selection of sandwiches/ flatbreads etc. Nice place to eat and hang out for a bit.
Great coffee, great service, great atmosphere! We will be back, a lot.
Great placr
Great atmosphere, and great coffee.. a 20 minute wait for said coffee though? The answer is no
Always a pleasure to grab some Java and interact with the wonderful staff. I would urge a little tweaking of the app. But bonus is app failings let me see staff at register instead!

Was traveling for work and stopped by Queen City Grounds for a Matcha. Oh, how I wish I was local so that I could go back everyday!!! I don't always have high expectations for a Matcha but this place did it right! Very friendly workers in addition to the great drink.

I used to come to Queen City Grounds and always loved the food and service. I had not come in a while and let me tell you, things have changed quite a bit. First, my food order took around 35 min for an avocado toast. Second, I ordered an egg avocado toast and only one piece of toast had an egg on it and the second did not. I asked the server and he said that's how it's done. Third, the avocado was so green and unripe it was hard to eat. I won't be coming back here again.
Walked all the way here while visiting to get coffee and food and was told they have no food today. I was trying to support local but......

We had a girl I believe named Devin,take our order. She was not friendly whatsoever. I asked her if she was the owner, which I figured she wasn't. If only the owners knew how the employees could be heard all the way from upstairs cussing. The girl at the front needs to be trained on customer service and learn about the items and products sold at this coffee shop  so that her answer isn't " yeah I don't know", every time a question is asked about a product. My husband has social anxiety so when he orders he might ask a few extra questions and stumble on his words. You're working with the public learn how to be kind. There was no one behind us so a little patience and hospitality would be appreciated.
Great coffee and atmosphere!
Great spot for good coffee/food and good vibes!! Macho brings the heat on the music too!
Asha made a fruity pebble drink for me and it was so good! I love coming here it's always good vibes and the food comes out fast!! The managers listen to feedback and are always trying to get better!
Guy working the counter was extremely rude.
Delicious drinks, kind staff, and plenty of seating options. I loved that they validate parking for 2-hours, making it easy to park in the garage next door and spend some time working on my laptop.

Coffee and service were amazing! Barista gave my friend and I recommendations for our coffee taste and preference and we were both amazed! Her friendliness and skill for coffee are unmatched! She deserves that Fruity Pebble matcha tea on the menu! :)
Queen City grounds over any coffee shop in Charlotte !!
As a vegan because of health problems, the vegan options here are INCREDIBLE. The best brunch I've had in months. Traveling for work and ended the trip with this food was by far perfection.
Josue is always so friendly and accommodating. Always have a great experience here, love all of their food options, especially that they have vegan substitutions for almost everything.

Cute setting and decor. Customer service mediacore once inside No greetings just stares from the staff (uncomfortable feeling). Make sure you love what you are ordering even if you have never ordered from here because they do not accommodate changing your order due of distasteful vegan chorizo on the breakfast sandwich (would not recommend...0/10)
Was made to pay for another order. Which is uncommon in most restaurants.
Did like the girts and coffee . Our toddler likes the just egg pattie.

Excellent vibe, really chill atmosphere. We went on Friday (their "live music" night), and really enjoyed our time. The staff were super hospitable and accommodating. All around nice place. You'll feel welcomed here!
10 times better than Starbucks.
terrible customer service and communication

Nice and relaxing, love the upstairs space. On the pricier side but not a rip off. Great place to meet up, get coffee or just read. I felt like the espresso and food was high quality. Happy with my experience (:

This is one of the most chill coffee shops in downtown. As long as you bring your positive vibes and around 20 dollars they got you covered. They have lovely and prompt service - even if you are unsure of what to order they are happy to help every step of the way. Lovely atmosphere and chill coffee vibes.
Interesting mix of coffee shop on one side and bar on the other. But service was good in here. Good selection of beer. Will come again.

Great chill vibe in the morning. Someone picked up my Togo order and they quickly apologized and made me another. Excellent service!!

Golden chai and vegan bacon egg and cheese both perfection!
Really like the coffee
Great food and excellent customer service
That breakfast burrito was something serious. I ain't even get to take it home yet to eat. I just ate it on the way home.... It's That good ... And Vegan asl

Not for US. Came here this morning for breakfast a quick bagel and a burrito. Simple order. No coffee no sweets. My order took 45 mins to come out the kitchen. In that time I saw 4 other burritos and bagel come out there kitchen. Non of which mine when I finally went to the counter after waiting thirty mins. The informed me my order was just getting into the oven. Being the only black person in the building and be the last served is disgusting. When my food finally came out not only was it wrong it and it was plated for in house consumption. I asked for to go. Overall horrible experience for a out of town customer. Highly don't recommend.

Style/design: 5/5
Location: 4/5
Service: 1/5
Came on a Sunday late afternoon and it was pretty busy. Menu seemed decent but no real GF options. Both the person who took our order and the person who made our drink both had poor attitudes.
A tad pricey but good specialty coffee. Being able to see their roaster certainly helps you appreciate their roasts.
Love their food and coffee... the service is what needs a lil pick me up

I just got a job here and I'm so loving this place  FAMILY orientated and wonderful diverse environment. Weekly itinerary for the guests from music bingo to open mic ... feel free to stop by and get GROUNDED @QUEEN CITY'S FINEST.
Great coffee and pastries
Loved the look and feel of this place! The guy that helped me was super sweet and patient...this was my first time here! Food was great!
I'm visiting from New York, and this place gave me the best latte I have ever had in my life, and I buy coffee five days a week. The staff was lovely and I wish I could give 10 stars.
my favorite neighborhood spot. I love the coffee and the food but what I love the most are the people that work here and make it such a special experience every time
Our favorite spot. Good food, good customer service, and all around good vibes
Here each week for coffee while my daughter has ballet at CBT - yummy coffee and a great selection of baked goods, and more savory plates, too! Great vibe inside plus ample outdoor seating.
Love this place. The coffee and the people are amazing!

I was in Charlotte last week and found this place. Very cute coffee shop with nice selection of coffee. It's a perfect place to grab a coffee and work. There is a printer there as well if you need to print something for home or work.
Good place for a business meeting, nice atmosphere. Parking on the street is convenient.
Matcha was impeccable, along with the vibe to concentrate on work.

Really good lunch food here! So far everything I have ordered is super tasty. It's one of the best places for lunch I have ever been to and it is my go to by default in uptown. Also their vegan options are incredible. I highly recommend.

Very fun & unique coffee shop / cafe that feels like a brewery. Lots of seating, tall ceilings, WiFi, outlets. Definitely worth a visit if you need a place to hang with friends or work while in downtown CLT!
Great ambience !! Genuinely one of the best and fresh hot chocolate in the town. Me, my wife and a friend spent almost 4 hours playing board games followed by Thursday fun music BINGO

Dropped by to kill some time on the weekend - mostly because they're open late. Good central spot with easy street parking around, nice huge space with lots of seating, big windows, and table lamps. Quick service and good drinks - the vanilla latte was great. They have The Landing upstairs which I assume hosts some events, because they had a comedy show going on while I was there. Overall, good not-too-unique coffee shop with what you need - seating, lighting, and a comfortable atmosphere. Probably going to be a go To when I'm uptown.

I ordered a breakfast burrito and an oatmilk cappuccino.
The coffee was AMAZING and the food was great as well. 100% recommended!
Best coffee roaster/shop in CLT. Great atmosphere, awesome food.

Super fun coffee shop in downtown Charlotte.  Very nice coffee selection with onsite roasting.  AMAZING lunch menu with one of the best sandwiches in town- The Sleep Token.  Killer bar specials.  A perfect place to stop and work for the afternoon.  Love this place.
The exact coffee shop vibe you're looking for.

The staff is always down to earth,
Up to talk, and rightly available for your service, they've left the bad at home in their 2 bedroom apartments just so we don't have to deal with it.
Good options for coffee and food. Friendly ambiance. Vegan options also available!

Hands down one of the best vegan breakfasts I've ever had! So nice to eat at a place where every item can be made vegan! Their golden chai latte was also amazing and such good prices. Highly recommend!
Decent coffee, takes forever to get your drink, been there 5 times and never gotten it in a reasonable amount of time.
I got a Vanilla Latta, it's fantastic.  Not burnt, not overly sweet.  It's smooth, it's juuust right.  The location is really neat.  Check out the 2nd floor, it's very chill.
The grilled cheese is simple but perfectly done. The golden Chai was just okay. Matcha also missed the spot. The hot chocolate & coffee on the other hand were good. The service is always good!

Wanted to thank Tyler and his staff for the amazing hospitality and customer service. The food was great and the atmosphere speaks for itself. Upstairs is really comfortable so as of today go see Tyler and his staff.
Love this place!  Try to hit it every time I'm in town!
Barista was rude and couldn't follow instructions. "For here" means that you want to have it at the store.

I stopped by on a layover and was pleasantly surprised by their expansive vegan selection. I had a vegan bacon, egg, sausage, and cheese sandwich with Queen sauce-- that was delicious- and an oat milk latte. Service was quick, the vibes were chill, and my food was great! I'll definitely be back to try more options as well as some lunch items.
I love their core values and vegan breakfast sandwiches
Awesome vegan options and Chai lattes!
Nitro latte is very good!  Not too sweet but packs a punch.  Easy parking in the sky house parking deck.  They will validate up to 2 hours with QR code scannable tickets when you exit the deck.

Love the atmosphere of the cafe. I like getting a coffee and sitting in the top floor to relax on the weekend mornings. Very quiet for the most part. We also found the art on the wall to be super intriguing and even purchased a piece.

Don't really do "fancy coffee" but the folks I was helping pet sit for only had "really fancy coffee makers" and this was a quick walk.  Super helpful and friendly staff that offered up some great Guatamalan drip coffee. (I guess that just means regular)  It's REALLY GOOD!  Oven was broken so no food and the Americana is also pretty damn fantastic.  I won't ever go out of my way to come Uptown, but if I am ever staying a block away again, it will definitely be an every morning thing as it has been.
The best part of my mornings!

Coffee was great, bagels were great!  Unfortunately, the oven was down during our visit so we couldn't try most of the food items, but there were still enough options available.  Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  There is a cute wall of "Pay It Forward" tickets where people have purchased drinks and left little notes for those in need of a pick me up.
They were out of a lot of items when we went but the coffee and tea were very good, as well as the food!
A solid cafe. Friendly staff and two floors with a comfy atmosphere.

Queen City Grounds is my favorite coffee shop in the City of Charlotte. The staff know how to make some of the best lattes I've ever tried. QCG is also one of the few places in the Charlotte area that you can get a fully vegan breakfast. You could easily spend the whole day here with the breakfast, lunch, dinner offerings. Also a great place to spend a nice evening with local craft beers or seltzers from Summit. All around one of my favorite places in CLT. If you haven't gone here then you are missing out.

Pic is the Barvecue special sammie. It's not currently on the normal menu but maybe in the future???
$8 for a basic latte  Do not reccomend. There are so many places to get better coffee for a cheaper price.
Nice place to grab fresh coffee, homemade breakfast sandwiches, and they do gluten free

This is the best authentic cappuccino you're going to find in Charlotte. A lot of the credit also goes to the barista who knows the proper milk to espresso ratio and milk foam consistency. It is also served in a ceramic mug as it should be.
After a 1.5 year search this ranks at the top of my coffee shop list. BRAVO

Price: $4.00
Fantastic cold brew and very friendly staff
One of the only places in Uptown that has vegan breakfast sandwiches! It's tasty and just what I need when I'm running late for work. The coffee is delicious too!
Great coffee and plant based options

UPDATE: My experience here has changed and now I've rated Queen City Grounds a 5! I've recently gotten the Impossible burger and the chicken sand-which and both are amazing. I recommend the ranch on both. The service has been much better and the food comes out in a timely manner. The staff is very friendly. Definitely give this place a try!

My experiences have been really bad. The first time I ordered a breakfast burrito, it took 45 minutes. They had given food to everyone else that ordered after me. I asked for a status update. Instead of telling me they lost my order or forgot, they just said they were still working on it. How? The second time I went, I ordered online, because I had a little puppy with me. I was working outside, since they had signs on their window saying they can't allow dogs inside. When I ordered online I asked in the comments for them to bring it outside since I can't come in. I waited 30 minutes, before realizing that they must not be bringing it outside. When I went in my order was sitting at the pick up window and they just ignored the note I wrote even though it was printed on the receipt. The sandwich was cold and soggy by the time I got it. Customer service is not their forte. I wanted to support their partnership with Summit Seltzer and new opening at night hours, but they need to work on customer service.

Coffee was great the front desk cashier was polite and chipper. The food I ordered was one thing online but different on the menu in the cafe. So I got the BLT but couldn't find any bacon on my first half of the sandwich but then I took it apart for the staff to show them I couldn't find Bacon. They showed me a tiny piece on the other half only and didn't seem to want to make another. If you're working on a menu and the first ingredient is bacon, you might expect to have a visible portion on the sandwich. Side note the online menu said on toast but the menu here was on a veggie wrap. Last part of my rant the item said thick cut bacon, the piece we found on one half was the same you see at Subway that's thin and small. I'll try again some other time, the menu looks great and has a lot of appealing options.
The building is beautiful and they have a great decor. Thanks for the coffee y'all it was wonderful.
One of the best in town, will definitely come again. Very balanced latte taste, served in large ceramic mugs.

Their house coffee blend strikes a deep-toned flavor bell for me. It's just my personal favorite. And the creative barista blends are nicely balanced between coffee, dairy, flavor. But please don't go because I want all the fabulous seating, music, reading/working vibe all to myself. I can tell by their actions over time that the management has a soul. Thanks for supporting CBA students and family and your community in general. Please keep making your creamy grits--but I only get them when I'm not on the run because you must be cooking them on the stove just for me.
Great food options for all sorts (including vegan / vegetarian) & coffee is good is well. Great atmosphere!

My favorite coffee in charlotte!! Well trained baristas and good quality coffee beans, would recommend the flat white!
The place atmosphere is enjoyable and relaxing.

I work in the area and love to pop by Queen City Grounds (which is currently rebranding to become 'The Landing') and grab a bite to eat or some caffeine. My favorites include the Soul Glo and Simple Life bagel sandwiches - which both have vegan options!

Used to have delcious vegan breakfast. Last month I noticed they messed up the order of a couple. I noticed and suggested the manager to give them store credit and he ignored me. Fast forward to today, my vegan egg burrito was missing eggs. Basically raw onions in a wrap. Disgusting tasting. I expected them to give me a store credit or something to make up for it. I am not going to ask for it. Nothing kills like success. RIP fav vegan place.
Spacious neighborhood coffeeshop with great espresso and the best breakfast burrito in Charlotte (The Burrito You Want)
Fantastic cappuccino & matcha latte (added lavender, it was AMAZING). Will definitely be back!

I went to their location off of North Church Street on 12 August 2022, at approximately 9:15.
1. The lady with red dye in her hair was not friendly when she took my order, not rude, but clearly dismissive.
2. She ended up writing my name down wrong for the order I guess, so I obviously didn't respond when they called my name (there were plenty of other guest, figured it was theirs). Not a big deal, but the same lady finally came up to me (red dyed hair) and said "we've called your name like 5 times" as she delivered the coffee to our table, in the most disrespectful way possible. Then proceeded to roll her eyes as she walked off.
3. I clearly didn't know what name that they had down so the same thing happened for my food except she got my attention hollered at me to come get the food. Not a big deal, except, I finally mentioned that I think you got my name wrong, to which again she rolled her eyes and another staff joked that "it's such a big deal"
4. Our drinks were labeled wrong (it was two drinks), so we each took a sip of each other's drink.

Lastly, one of these issues not a big deal, I get it people have bad days. But the lady with the red dyed hair is truly not meant for this job and this establishment will no longer get my business. I was a frequent customer, not anymore, this is pathetic.
Excellent coffee  Flat white was just PERFECT  perfect place to relax

Such a cute coffee shop! We were visiting Charlotte for the weekend and we're so happy we stopped in Queens City Grounds to start our day. Two stories with lots of seating options to work or study. Their staff was friendly and fast. The cold brew was great and I also enjoyed a delicious breakfast bagel sandwich. Their Pay It Forward wall was such an amazing concept to foster kindness

The coffee and breakfast sandwich were delicious. I loved the atmosphere. I really enjoyed the lay it forward wall. Such a great way to bring the community together. It's also in a really cute park of town with historical homes.

Good food and drinks, one issue is with online orders. If you order both food and drink online they only print the order at the drink station and you'll have to ask for them to make the food. I ordered online and waited 45 minutes in store for the order to be ready because of the ordering disconnect.
Great place to sit and have coffee while knocking out some work. Aesthetic is pleasing, seasonal menu's are good (especially Autumn), and good customer service. A little pricey but worth it!
Unbelievably good vegan options. Great music, great coffee, really cool atmosphere, huge fan of this place.
The Sweet Victory and Golden Chai make a good pairing!  There's good music playing here and the barista was very welcoming to my tired soul!
Great coffee, hippy interiors and lots of space to sit and hang out.
Good coffee
Hands down best breakfast burrito in town and it's not even close.

I completely fell in love with this place! The fact that they have vegan options and just eggs makes it better! I wish we would have found this sooner because we would have of ate breakfast here everyday for our stay !

This place is my new favorite local Vegan friendly takeout spot for breakfast! They not only have options for non Vegans, but for those of us who are Vegan or willing to try it they've got LOTS of options for us which include a given number of specifically Vegan menu items, but the reality is that anything on their menus can be customized to your preference. They also sell my friend Morathi's product Kikaboni Sea Moss gel. I  You Queen City Grounds!!!
Friendly staff, great coffee and gluten-free/vegan options!
If you have the chance to get the Nitro Latte, it's going to be worth it.
Known for its coffee I guess but, the tea here is just as amazing. Real leaf selection and best of all it's a great place to hangout and cycle to.
Best coffee ever, good service and the staff with the best vibes

Great hot espresso but iced espresso (americano) tasted superrrr burnt and they were out of cold brew by 11am on Saturday. Very cute interior, great attentive staff. Food menu only displayed at the register (would suggest putting it on the wall), and the food is quite expensive for being so average (the bagel is mediocre and too salty, and tasted like a Dunkin sandwich). Personally, I wouldn't return, but it's quite convenient for the area.
Pretty average coffee at average price. Very slow every time I go there and doesn't take call in orders. Online ordering system is chownow which up charges you to place an order in advance.

I am leaving 1 star because I have to.  Worst experience in all my history of coffee shops.  The guy (who I thought was maybe a female...no name tag) at the register stood there pushing buttons on the register when I arrived appearing to be very busy despite the fact I was the only customer in line or waiting.  He didn't say "one moment" "I will be right with you" or "can I help you".  I am a nice guy, so I did not interrupt.  I stood there waiting for him to finish and after about 5 minutes, I assumed the machine was broke.  So, I spoke up and politely asked, "can I place the order and pay in cash (no change needed).  He then looked up and very smugly said, "I'm waiting on you to order, what do you want".  I was instantly annoyed but, like I said, I'm a nice guy and let it go.  I politely apologized for the confusion and ordered my drink.  He was very rude.  Didn't tell me a total, flipped the screen around and walked away.  He whispered several times to the female making the drinks and they just kept looking at me laughing.  When it was done, he grabbed the drink and sat it on the pick up counter and walked away without saying anything.  The drink was horrible having purposely been sabotaged by the female under the man's instruction.  It wasn't an innocent mistake where it was not hot enough or too sweet.  It was not drinkable AT ALL.  I threw the drink away, looked at both of them, and walked out.  I sent two white coworkers there immediately after I left and they did not have the same experience and much better cups of coffee.  In that regard, clearly an isolated incident of racism.  Just a heads up to Management who may or may not be condoning this despicable behavior....this does not stop at my review.  I will be reporting this establishment and incident to the BBB, Chamber, CA, and any other platform to ensure everyone knows what to expect when visiting Queen City Grounds.
It's great place for breakfast. Very delicious food
One of the best vegan burgers I've tasted

Coffee is great, but service is always incredibly slow - especially morning service. I've placed to go orders 10-15 minutes before arrival with hope that I could pick up before I go into office. It has never worked. I end up waiting 10+ minutes each time as they prepare my order.
Great customer service and good coffee. Clean

I like to come here to work sometimes. I work remotely, and it's nice to change up the scenery. There's plenty of seating options for a casual coffee with friends, a work meeting, or working from a laptop. I typically sit upstairs because it's more quiet. Their draft oat milk latte is my favorite, they rotate the flavors. I've eaten breakfast and lunch here before, everything I've had to eat is also good. I've gotten it to go plenty of times also and you can order online which is convenient.

This place is probably the best coffee in charlotte and the hot chocolate is one of the best I've had! They have plenty of vegan breakfast options and will typically offer a vegan pastry, I would recommend trying the crimson raider. The atmosphere inside is really nice and there is plenty of room to sit and hang out

Never fails! Drinks are always creative and delicious, and the food is a star. Does all the little things right, and nail it each time they swing for the fences with a wild special/new item. A personal favorite for sure.

EDIT MARCH 3 2022 :  Still rules.

Friendly and entertaining staff
Cozy atmosphere.
Smells DELICIOUS.
Beer,  seltzer,  wine, coffee and some incredibly yummy looking sandwiches ( they must be amazing because every other person was eating )
Excellent staff excellent latte
Great options for vegans!
Perfect coffee while traveling the US. Breakfast begel was delicious too.
Please bring back the Gocudang BLT
Great staff and environment.
Excellent cappuccino and drip coffee. Definitely try any one of the burritos. Superstar staff members.
really good black coffee, and the food is spectacular. the atmosphere is really cozy as well, and the seating area available is comfortable and relaxing.

Delicious breakfast burrito, probably the best I've had, great ingredients (eggs, bacon, advocado and more),  loved the spicyness.  Very good vibe, great place to have breakfast or your coffee in a relaxing atmosphere.
Overpriced for just ok coffee. The food options look good

If you're looking for a place that serves fantastic coffee made with love, care, and passion, look no further. Queen City Grounds definitely has the coffee game on lock in Charlotte. The Flat White I had was simply the best cup of coffee I've had outside of my own home. It also helps that they roast their coffee beans in-house to meticulous quality.

The staff is super friendly, the coffee shop is always super clean, they also have some pretty tasty sandwiches, and the upstairs loft has some of the best views of Fourth Ward.

Come on in. Get a cup. Do some of that work you've been wanting to get done or just chill out for a while. On your way out, buy a bag of their beans to take home. And yes, they will happily grind it up for you.
It's good
So cute and really nice staff!
Great place to get a cup of coffee or a quick bite to eat. Staff is very friendly. My go to coffee shop uptown.
"Easily 40x better than Starbucks" - girlfriend. She loves their cold brew, I like their strawberry banana smoothies, and their burrito is out of this world.

After a morning hike i decided to have local coffee and I searched for it and came through Queen City Grounds. It was a nice small coffee shop with different people buying coffee on Sunday morning. The parking can be an issue as it has a road parking and sometimes you may not get the place. The ambience of the cafe was amazing and i loved the vibes. The menu is amazing and has different coffee options. I ordered Cappuccino hot coffee. I got the order quickly and it was amazing. I loved the coffee. Do try this as it is an amazing place.

Stopped in for some coffee to go, and was quite amazed at what a cool spot this is. The coffee is fine, if a bit expensive, but the location as a spot to relax, study, read or get some work done is quite exemplary. It's well appointed, with lots of comfy places to sit, and various excellent views. Next time I'm in the area and need a place to hang out for a bit, I'd definitely return!
Solid cup o Joe and an awesome atmosphere to hang out or get some work done!

My Chai Latte was perfect, and the young lady working there was extremely kind and professional. She even gave me advice on places to check out in Charlotte.
The views from this Uptown coffee joint are pleasant and sweet. But the coffee is sweeter.

Haven't tried the coffee yet because I still havent gotten it after 30 minutes of ordering 2 iced lattes. The guy taking my order today seemed like he didnt want to be there, he was asking people if they wanted cream or sugar and then after someone replied cream please, he told them to go get it themselves at the self serve bar. Whats the point? Customer service alone is a 1 or 2 out of 5. Lets see how the coffee is.

Got the coffee. One was 4 shots, iced whole milk. The other 3 shots, iced, oat milk. I asked the dark curly haired barista if the milks were correct in the drinks (dairy intolerance) and she literally said, "I forget at this point". Not coming back, maybe find better baristas who care about the craft. I paid around $13 and a $2 tip.
The best coffee in Charlotte.

New to the Charlotte and received a welcome packet with coupons from various restaurants and such in the area.  Queen City Grounds had a gift certificate for $10 in the packet, so we stopped by and ordered the Chai drink.  It was fabulous and went back again this week.  You've gained a new customer with your marketing coupon.  Thank you!
Best draft cold brew I have ever had
We just ordered take out but the atmosphere was amazing, will definitely be coming back to enjoy the place and the food and drinks.
A well run and trendy coffee shop that had excellent Nitro brew on tap. Stop by if you're in the area for sure!
Omg the corn chips in my breakfast burrito were amazing!! Nice and spicy. Perfect cappuccino.

Service was quick, and the grit bowl was INCREDIBLE. Very filling and great portion size. I was only visiting for a couple days, but it was some of the best coffee we had while in the city! The "Le Tigre" was very unique and delicious!

Our favorite local CLT Coffee shop! Not only do they have an amazing coffee lineup but rotating specialty coffee drinks (plus non coffee drinks too) AND made to order breakfast. My favorite breakfast burritos!
Been going here for so long. Love that they have so many vegan options!
Best coffee in Charlotte! Iced vanilla oat milk latte is one of the best I've ever had! And the service is always friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend!!

found this spot a few weeks back (was referred by Central Coffee since they didn't yet allow seating). spacious, clean & a friendly staff (special shout out to Kiara), this is one of my favorite coffee joints. I especially appreciate the seating options (tables, counter by the bar, comfy lounge- upstairs). oh yeah, the wifi is aces & they got plenty of outlets for juicing your electronics. gracias guys :)

I love QCG! The coffee is delicious- I suggest the cold brew with oat milk! The food is made to order, tasty and they have a lot vegetarian options. Inclusive place and all are welcome. This atmosphere is delightful! They've recently added some great new tables outside and we get to comfortably bring our dog along now too!
Yummy vegan option food and good coffee. Great vibe as well with a decent amount of indoor seating. Would recommend!
